intro: Boea minahassae, commonly known as the Minahassa ivy, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It is a climbing vine that belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, known for its ornamental value. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red or orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Boea minahassae is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
